item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Tuesday, December 17, 2024 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Let's Encrypt will begin offering 6-day certificates (29 points | 30 comments)
2. CRUNCH - a compiler for statically typed Scheme with a minimal runtime (12 points | no comments)
3. Why Should a Unix Shell Have Objects? (14 points | 4 comments)
4. Running NetBSD on IBM ThinkPad 380Z (45 points | 14 comments)
5. Go's Weird Little Iterators (6 points | 5 comments)
6. Django security hardenings that are not happening (2 points | 6 comments)
7. Go Protobuf: The new Opaque API - The Go Programming Language (30 points | 6 comments)
8. Everyone gets bidirectional BFS wrong (32 points | 5 comments)
9. Utilizing highly synchronized clocks in distributed databases (7 points | 3 comments)
10. Reconstructing a music recommendation model (6 points | 6 comments)
11. Re: Re: Bluesky and Decentralization (62 points | 36 comments)
12. Carbon Copy Newsletter No.5 (7 points | 5 comments)
13. Using Guile for Emacs (37 points | 10 comments)
14. Interactive diagrams for complex systems (5 points | no comments)
15. Ablet: An EASY way to create TUIs in Rust (5 points | 1 comment)
16. What's new in Ruby 3.4 (18 points | 25 comments)
17. Announcing systemd v257 (6 points | no comments)
18. 20 years of Linux on the Desktop (part 2) (13 points | 4 comments)
19. Contributing an mdoc reader to Pandoc (16 points | no comments)
20. LFGSS and Microcosm shutting down 16th March 2025 (the day before the Online Safety Act is enforced) (4 points | 2 comments)
21. Pizarra (4 points | no comments)
22. Making WebAssembly and Wasmtime More Portable (4 points | no comments)
23. Advent of Code on the Nintendo DS (28 points | 3 comments)
24. Effectful - Build Fast & Reliable Haskell Applications (1 points | no comments)
25. Tools for Go modules (21 points | no comments)
